items.title: Disappeared bodies, mass burials and ‚Äò30,000 dead‚Äô: what is the truth of Iran‚Äôs death toll?
items.content_html:
Testimony from medics, morgue and graveyard staff reveals huge state effort to conceal systematic killing of protesters

On Thursday 8 January, in a midsize Iranian town, Dr Ahmadi‚Äôs* phone began to buzz. His colleagues in local emergency wards were getting worried.

All week, people had taken to the streets and had been met by police with batons and pellet guns. With treatment, their injuries should not have been too serious. But emergency room staff believed many wounded young people were avoiding hospitals, terrified that registering as trauma patients would lead to their identification and arrest.

items.title: ‚ÄòThey told us to leave. They didn‚Äôt tell us where to go‚Äô: the demolitions destroying homes and lives in Lagos
items.content_html:
Makoko‚Äôs waterfront stilt settlements were razed with little warning amid government claims that the move was essential for sanitation and security

It was 12.30pm when amphibious excavators escorted by armed police roared through Makoko, crushing wooden shacks built on stilts. ‚ÄúIt was the second time this year,‚Äù says Augustine Agpoko, 42, a fisher and father of eight whose six-bedroom bungalow was demolished on 16 January.

Like many of his neighbours, Agpoko was already dismantling his home piece by piece in an attempt to save some of the materials before the machines arrived. ‚ÄúI was removing my roofing sheets, trying to salvage materials from my house when the bulldozers began demolition,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúWhen they started firing tear gas into the air, I had to quickly evacuate my family to safety in a neighbouring community, because one of my two wives is in her second trimester.‚Äù

Continue reading...

A wave of violence has left transgender people afraid to go out, as experts say the global rise of far-right ideology is fuelling transphobia

It was past midnight but Zehrish Khanzadi and Bindiya Rana were still up, drinking tea, when the doorbell rang. Within seconds of Rana unlocking the door remotely from the kitchen, three shots rang out. ‚ÄúThe men fled and she narrowly escaped all three bullets,‚Äù Khanzadi says of her colleague and housemate.

Both trans women work for the Gender Alliance Interactive (GIA), an organisation that advocates for transgender rights, Rapa as its head and Khanzadi as a rights activist.

items.title: ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt they have mercy?‚Äô: A mother on losing her son in a record year of Saudi executions
items.content_html:
Essam al-Shazly is the latest foreign national to die in a ‚Äòhorrifying‚Äô surge in capital punishment under the rule of Mohammed bin Salman

In his four years on death row, Essam al-Shazly‚Äôs mother was his only contact with the outside world. During their daily calls she would calm his fears, control her own tears and listen to his hopes of returning home.

Speaking from the family home in Hurghada, a tourist resort on Egypt‚Äôs Red Sea coast, she says he would tell her, ‚ÄúMom, I talk to you because I want to forget what I‚Äôm going through. Don‚Äôt ask me anything about prison.‚Äù

items.title: Lawmakers Seek to Extend Temporary Protected Status for Haitian Immigrants
items.content_html:
January 26, 2026 ‚Äì Representative Ayanna Pressley (D-Massachusetts) filed a discharge petition last week to force a House vote on a bill to extend Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Haitians for three years. TPS allows immigrants from countries where living conditions are dangerous to live and work legally in the U.S. As we reported earlier […]

items.title: Monday, January 26 ‚Äî CFJC Evening News
The Trump Administration Is Losing The Support Of Local Law Enforcement
items.content_html: The thing with an invasion is that it makes enemies of everyone being invaded, even those who may nominally support the end goal. Law enforcement officers and officials are no exception, especially when they see the invading force creating problems they shouldn’t be expected to solve. Trump has treated multiple American cities like war zones. […]
